page.title: 15Tourism
page.content: The Offa's Dyke long distance path passes 1km to the east of the area bringing a large number of walkers to the area but they tend to be passing through and, apart from a few bed and breakfast establishments, the area does not benefit. Outside the area are a few camping and caravan sites which introduce a few walkers to this block. The roads carry a lot of through tourist traffic going from the Midlands to the coast but they stop only for picnics or at local towns for brief refreshment rather than shopping. Many cyclists pass through the area (as many as sixteen tourers in a day on occasion) but again do not stop.
